about.short: LAN-Cam is a LAN-only camera and screen streaming tool that broadcasts to multiple devices on the same Wi-Fi with low latency and zero internet dependency.
about.long:
LAN-Cam makes it simple to broadcast a screen or camera feed to nearby devices without cloud services or cables. Any laptop or phone can be a broadcaster; viewers join via discovery or a LAN URL/QR code, and everything stays inside your network for speed and privacy.

It works for classrooms, training rooms, quick demos, or home viewing. The focus is on low-latency streaming, straightforward discovery, and a frictionless UX for non-technical users.

roles_and_responsibilities: Defined core use-cases and kept the product LAN-first.
Designed discovery, signalling, and streaming architecture.
Built the desktop sender with screen/camera capture modes and the browser viewer.
Created join flows via auto-discovery, PIN, or QR-based URL with basic diagnostics.
objectives: Provide a lightweight LAN alternative to internet-dependent screen-sharing.
Make joining or broadcasting simple for non-technical users.
Keep all data on the local network for speed and privacy.

core_streaming: Screen sharing from desktop to any browser on the same LAN.
Camera mode to turn the device webcam into a LAN camera.
Optional audio streaming for lessons or demos.
Quality presets based on network conditions.
session_management: Named sessions for classrooms or rooms.
Auto-discovery on LAN with fallback manual join via URL/QR.
Optional PIN/room lock for access control.
viewing_experience: Latency indicator and auto-reconnect on brief drops.
Responsive layout for laptops, tablets, and phones.
modes_and_use_cases: Classroom mode: one broadcaster, many viewers.
Home theatre or quick mirroring to TV browser on Wi-Fi.
settings_and_admin: Toggle screen or camera mode and choose source.
Session stats like viewers count and basic bandwidth.

core_technology: WebRTC for low-latency audio/video over LAN.
WebSockets/signalling server for negotiation and control.
Local discovery via broadcast/mDNS where available.
desktop_app: Native OS capture APIs for screen/window capture.
web_client: React or plain HTML/JS viewer with responsive layout.
Fallback modes for limited WebRTC support.
backend_and_services: Option to host signalling on LAN or small VPS.
Direct peer streaming on LAN by default.
deployment_and_ops: Desktop builds for major OSes (Windows first).
Configurable for local-only or mixed LAN/internet use.

lan_discovery_and_ux.summary: Implemented discovery, QR join, and simple configuration panel.

internal_beta.summary: Tested latency, compatibility, and usability in small setups.

ongoing_improvements.summary: Adding presets, diagnostics, and installers for wider release.

budget.notes: Equivalent value covering architecture, apps, signalling, and tests; primary cost is build time and devices.

challenges: Varying Wi-Fi quality and router configs affect latency.
Need to keep UX simple while offering useful settings.
Permissions and compatibility differ across OSes and browsers.
solutions: Used simple quality presets instead of complex bitrate controls.
Kept signalling minimal with WebRTC peer streaming by default.
Added clear permission prompts and fallback join flows when discovery fails.

qualitative: LAN-first tool removes dependence on internet-based screen sharing.
Classroom-style broadcasting where viewers use their own devices.
Foundation for a paid/pro version with recording and multi-presenter features.
outcomes.example_metrics_note: Early success is measured in latency stability and connection success; public metrics will follow after beta.
